meanings.definition: A device that combines several signals for transmission over a single channel.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexors in the control room efficiently send different signals through one cable.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed the multiplexors to streamline the data transfer process.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexors at the concert made sure all the music reached the audience without any mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled conductor, the multiplexors orchestrated the flow of information seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexors acted like traffic cops, directing the data to its destination smoothly.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that multiplexes.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexors efficiently managed the different signals for transmission.
meanings.sent2: The team leader was the multiplexors, coordinating the tasks among the group.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexors in the office made sure everyone stayed on track with their work.
meanings.sent4: She was like a multiplexors, juggling multiple responsibilities effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexors in the play directed the actors to deliver a flawless performance.
